content.raw: This pull request wasn't merged in time for the GitHub migration. I've pulled this branch into our repository so it will be migrated to GitHub together with the rest of the code. Feel free to reopen the pull request there.
content.html: This pull request wasn't merged in time for the GitHub migration. I've pulled this branch into our repository so it will be migrated to GitHub together with the rest of the code. Feel free to reopen the pull request there.

content.raw: The sdf version has been set to 1.6
content.html: The sdf version has been set to 1.6

update.description: Here is a proposal for a tutorial on the `track_visual` feature (see related pull request [#1980](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1980/new-section/diff) in gazebo).
update.title: New tutorial on track_visual

content.raw: `<static>`, `<use_model_frame>`, `<xyz>`, `<inherit_yaw>` are sdf 1.6 only, but the example world the user is supposed to download at the beginning is sdf 1.5.
content.html: <static>, <use_model_frame>, <xyz>, <inherit_yaw> are sdf 1.6 only, but the example world the user is supposed to download at the beginning is sdf 1.5.

content.raw: I recommend adding `<pose>-2 0 2 0 0 0</pose>` under the `<camera ...>` tag. Without it on gazebo 7.8 I see the camera moves with the box, but the box isn't in view.
content.html: I recommend adding <pose>-2 0 2 0 0 0</pose> under the <camera ...> tag. Without it on gazebo 7.8 I see the camera moves with the box, but the box isn't in view.

content.raw: I updated the track_visual branch with the latest commits by @ocrave
content.html: I updated the track_visual branch with the latest commits by @ocrave

content.raw: This particular example has been updated to better show the impact of setting `inherit_yaw` to `true`.
content.html: This particular example has been updated to better show the impact of setting inherit_yaw to true.

content.raw:
The examples are great, the tutorial is really helpful!

Would you mind adding some list or table to the tutorial summarizing all the parameters, kind of how you did in the comments of the other pull requests? Thanks!
content.html:
The examples are great, the tutorial is really helpful!

Would you mind adding some list or table to the tutorial summarizing all the parameters, kind of how you did in the comments of the other pull requests? Thanks!

content.raw: humm I'm not sure what you meant by the "back and forth" above and the "flawlessly" here. In both cases the movement is kinda jumpy for me.
content.html: humm I'm not sure what you meant by the "back and forth" above and the "flawlessly" here. In both cases the movement is kinda jumpy for me.

content.raw: Maybe say the "model origin"? The camera might actually go inside the model.
content.html: Maybe say the "model origin"? The camera might actually go inside the model.

content.raw: You can see in the preview that one line is indented differently here. I *think* it's due to the number of spaces before `<static`
content.html: You can see in the preview that one line is indented differently here. I think it's due to the number of spaces before <static

content.raw: Wow, weird how this is rendering in the preview even if the url doesn't work yet. The mysteries of include...
content.html: Wow, weird how this is rendering in the preview even if the url doesn't work yet. The mysteries of include...

content.raw:
Thanks for the feature and the tutorial!

We currently don't support previewing tutorials from forks, so I pulled in your branch to the osrf repo. I also added the tutorial to the manifest (d665c43), you should be able to update the pull request pulling the `track_visual` branch from this repo.

Here's a preview of the category page:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=tools_utilities&branch=track_visual

And of the tutorial:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=track_visual&cat=tools_utilities&branch=track_visual
content.html:
Thanks for the feature and the tutorial!

We currently don't support previewing tutorials from forks, so I pulled in your branch to the osrf repo. I also added the tutorial to the manifest (d665c43), you should be able to update the pull request pulling the track_visual branch from this repo.

Here's a preview of the category page:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=tools_utilities&branch=track_visual

And of the tutorial:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=track_visual&cat=tools_utilities&branch=track_visual
